intro: Strychnos mimfiensis, commonly known as the Malagasy strychnos, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are follicles that split open to release seeds, and it is often found in dry forest habitats. Due to its restricted range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
